intro: Salix arbutifolia f. adenantha, commonly known as the腺叶柳 or腺叶柳, is a shrub-like plant belonging to the willow family (Salicaceae). It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring glandular dots on the underside, which give it its specific epithet "adenantha." The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its small, catkin-like flowers appear in early spring, followed by the development of narrow, elongated leaves. This form is a natural variant of Salix arbutifolia, showcasing genetic diversity within the species.
